quest.name: Unto the Morrow
journal: Urianger regards you with a gentle smile.
objectives: Speak with Ryne in the Crystarium.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Now, assuming thou intendest to continue thy tour, might I suggest Slitherbough as thy next destination?

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: The task of tidying up one's abode is seldom light work, yet I suspect Y'shtola's is heavier than most. Suffice it to say, a pair of helping hands might not go amiss.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Given its specificity to the Source, yon elemental chart is perhaps best removed.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Yet I cannot help but imagine what might unfold were a native of the First to chance upon it... What questions it would conjure in the mind of its discoverer...and whither their curiosity might lead them... 'Twould make for the beginnings of a grand adventure, would it not?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: And what is this? Have you come to spy on me?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: ...Does Urianger truly think me so slovenly? The nerve.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Loath as I am to disappoint, I put my affairs in order some time ago. I've even bade my farewells.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: To everyone save Runar, that is. He's nowhere to be seen...

dialogue.name: RUNAR
dialogue.text: Please take good care of Master Matoya. See that she eats well, and wraps up warm on cold days.

dialogue.name: RUNAR
dialogue.text: Ah, and there is a herbal tea which she enjoys! If I give you the recipe, you could make it for her, perhaps? And, uh...uh...

dialogue.name: RUNAR
dialogue.text: Above all─please keep her close. I do not deny that she is strong, but even the strongest among us should not be alone.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Honestly, he's a boy in the body of a man... <sigh>

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Anyway, it is time we headed back to the Crystarium. Shall we?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: ...You still have to take the Exarch to Nabaath Areng? I see. Very well, you can look in on Thancred while you're about it.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: His will be a difficult farewell, and I am sure he would appreciate your support.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: The path goes through Twine. If you wait there, you are like to meet him on his way back, if not before.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: As I make my way out of the wood, I shall call to mind all that I learned during my time here. And I shall picture the day of my return.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I know not when it will be, but mark my words, I will learn to traverse the rift.

dialogue.name: THAFFE
dialogue.text: Ah, it's you! Good to see you looking none the worse for wear!

dialogue.name: JERYK
dialogue.text: Let me guess: you're here to ride the trolley too. Don't ask me how I know─I can just tell!

dialogue.name: MAGNUS
dialogue.text: Eh? You too? What is this, my bloody nameday?

dialogue.name: MAGNUS
dialogue.text: I see, I see. Yes, Thancred was here─and Ryne too. They said they wanted to go to Nabaath Areng, so we gave them the use of the trolley.

dialogue.name: JERYK
dialogue.text: That's right, the old girl's up and running again! But we didn't just put her back together, mind you!

dialogue.name: JERYK
dialogue.text: No, with a little bit of help from Master Chai...

dialogue.name: JERYK
dialogue.text: We made her faster!

dialogue.name: JERYK
dialogue.text: And stronger!

dialogue.name: JERYK
dialogue.text: Ohhh yes, the future of trolleys is looking brighter than ever! Whisper it, but I reckon it might be time─time to reach for the stars with a trolley to dwarf all trolleys!

dialogue.name: THAFFE
dialogue.text: If you ask me, we'd be better off making them smaller. That way, they can fit in narrow shafts.

dialogue.name: JERYK
dialogue.text: But that─ That's genius! Why didn't I think of that!?

dialogue.name: MAGNUS
dialogue.text: Enough. You can daydream in your own time. In case you've forgotten, our priority is to have more working trolleys.

dialogue.name: MAGNUS
dialogue.text: That's why we turned to Chai-Nuzz, by the way─not to make the one trolley we've got go faster. We needed help getting a few Talos back in working order, see.

dialogue.name: MAGNUS
dialogue.text: We were out testing 'em when your airship came down, as a matter of fact. You seem to have a habit of crashing things...

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: We're back. Our thanks for the loan of the trolley.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: ...Forename? What are you doing here? Don't tell me the others are waiting for us?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: That's a relief. At any rate, we've done what we came to do─which means I'm ready to leave. Or as ready as I'll ever be.

dialogue.name: MAGNUS
dialogue.text: Not to pry, but what's going on? You off somewhere?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: You could say that...

dialogue.name: MAGNUS
dialogue.text: So you're heading home. I'm just a simple miner and don't know much about this world-traversing business...

dialogue.name: MAGNUS
dialogue.text: But the young lady here─she'll be looked after, will she?

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: I'll be fine, thank you. I have a place to stay at the Crystarium, and don't want for anything.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Besides which, I've recently made a new friend. Her name is Gaia, and she'll always be there if I need her. Just like you lot.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Besides which, I've no shortage of friends I can turn to. Friends like you lot.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: So please don't worry. I'll be fine, really.

dialogue.name: MAGNUS
dialogue.text: If you say so...

dialogue.name: MAGNUS
dialogue.text: It being a matter of life and death, I suppose you have to leave.

dialogue.name: MAGNUS
dialogue.text: But I for one would still be torn. If the choice were mine, I'm not sure I could bear to be parted from my family.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: No. But it's for the best. Ryne has chosen to walk her own path, and she doesn't need me under her feet.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Besides, I have my own responsibilities, and I wouldn't be setting a very good example if I neglected them.

dialogue.name: MAGNUS
dialogue.text: Hmph. Perhaps not. Either way, I envy you your dilemma.

dialogue.name: MAGNUS
dialogue.text: Well then, young lady... If there's anything you need─anything at all─you're to call on us. It may surprise you, but we can do more than simply offer you trolley rides.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Thank you, Magnus. Everyone.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Shall we, then?

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: If you've nowhere left to visit, we can go back to the Crystarium together.

dialogue.name: MAGNUS
dialogue.text: Bugger me, I forgot to thank Thancred...

dialogue.name: MAGNUS
dialogue.text: When you get the chance, tell him I'm glad we had that little talk. And tell him we'll look out for the girl.

dialogue.name: THAFFE
dialogue.text: When it comes to families, you'd think together was best, but it's not always that simple, is it? Never really thought about it, what with my parents being long gone.

dialogue.name: THAFFE
dialogue.text: The people in this town are the closest thing to family I've got. And to be fair, I'd hate to leave them. Which is why I'm not going anywhere!

dialogue.name: JERYK
dialogue.text: Mark my words, Forename: one day, Twine will thrive again, and I hope that Thancred can come back to see it. Him and that funny-talking, fortune-teller bloke!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I thought that it would be easier after saying farewell, but each step I took out of Eulmore felt heavier than the last...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I did everything I could in the time I had. No regrets.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: This is it, then...

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: I took the liberty of informing the Crystarium's leaders of our imminent departure. It seemed only right.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I trust the Exarch had a pleasant tour of the realm.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Oh, it's you... You're probably wondering why I'm not with the others.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: <sigh> It's just...I always knew that everyone would leave one day. And I always hoped and prayed that we would find a way to send them home. But now that the time has come, I just feel...lost. Lost and lonely.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: I don't want our last moments together to be sad. I want to hold myself together, just long enough to say the things that I need to say. But I'm not sure I can even do that...

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I'll be there with you.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: You can do it, Ryne.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: <sniff> Right.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Thank you, Forename. I think we all feel braver with you around. Go on ahead and join the others. I'll be along after I've taken a few deep breaths.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Thank you, Forename. I feel braver already. <sniff> Go on ahead and join the others. I'll be along after I've taken a few deep breaths.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: In...and out... <sigh>
